website_summaries.verdict: The Yamaha RX-V573 is a serviceable 7.1 AV receiver, but with only four HDMI inputs, competing models offer a better value.
pros: The Yamaha RX-V573 has built-in networking functionality, including AirPlay and Internet radio
It can also be controlled with a smartphone app available for iOS and Android
And its sound quality is solid with both music and movies
cons: Nearly every competing receiver offers more HDMI inputs at this price level
The included remote is difficult to use, and the user interface looks painfully dated

customer_reviews.title: Great for our home theater
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for 3 weeks now. Coupled it with a Boston Acoustics SoundWare XS 5.1 speaker system. The YPAO sound optimization for automatic speaker setup is easy to do. I had an existing center channel speaker so we're running 6.1 sound and it sounds great in our space. It takes some reading of the manual to make the tweaks, but the answers are there if you look closely. The only problem I had was getting it hooked up to the internet. I had to manually enter our network settings and it has worked great since doing that. Lots of interesting radio options available via its netradio. This is out of production unit so you can enjoy a nice discount.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Awesome most of the time.
customer_reviews.text: Periodic issue with screen turning all magenta. Power cycle (pulling power cable, count to ten and plug back in) clears it up until the next time. Seems to happen once every three months. I have the latest firmware and still occurs. Other shortcoming to mention is I have to wait for the receiver to "click" after powering on before I adjust volume or I won't get any sound. These aren't horrible issues, but not something you'd expect. Other than the two mentioned items, I love the options and performance of this receiver.
customer_reviews.author: pixfbsd

customer_reviews.title: Moved from a RX-V750 to a V573 for HDMI switching and couldn't be happier
customer_reviews.text: When this deal of the day popped up, I initially hesitated. Going from an RX-V750 to a V573 seemed like somewhat of a downgrade. I can honestly say I have zero regret. I did not notice any degradation in sound quality with the lower receiver lineand have enjoyed the HDMI switching even more than expected. As an added bonus, this unit is AnyNet capable, which has come in especially handy with my new Samsung SmarTV.
customer_reviews.author: T.R. Norman

customer_reviews.title: POS
customer_reviews.text: Junk. Had warranty work 2 years after purchasing due to one of the front channels going bad. Then, two of the HDMI inputs went bad and turned the screen blue. Not sure what happened to Yamaha quality, but now I have a new boat anchor because that's all its worth.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Receiver
customer_reviews.text: Great product and Fantastic Company. Had a problem after the warranty had expired. Contacted the Yamaha people and they fixed the problem any way at no charge to me!!!!! Thank you Yamaha, you have a loyal customer for life.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great receiver
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this receiver to replace an old one. Since it has more HDMI ports and allows audio to pass through the ports also, it eliminated my need for extra audio cables, digital audio assigning, and an HDMI hub. Also, the on-screen display really helps since I use it in a media room with a projector. Before, I had to get up and turn around to see things like volume settings as I changed them. Now it displays on screen. The sound is great also. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: TXtaster

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 3 months, took 8 weeks to get it repaired.
customer_reviews.text: The price was good on this unit, but about 3 and half months after purchase it refused to power on. Amazon is an authorized reseller for Yamaha so thankfully Yamaha will repair the unit as long as you take the unit to an authorized repair center. That was 55 miles away for me and the parts are on back order. I've been waiting 5 weeks already for the repair and the tech today said to expect at least another two weeks before I will get the unit back. This is the last Yamaha A/V anything I purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron M

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: After having this for 3 months or so, I have to say I love this receiver. The sound is great (if you have good speakers of course) but it is also accurate. The auto-normalizing feature for surround sound is spot on (despite being used in a HUGE cavernous great room with 26 foot ceilings). Have used the music collection/ playlist on a USB stick several times for gatherings and enjoyed the shuffle feature and customization settings.
customer_reviews.author: Siggy

customer_reviews.title: Works nicely once connected
customer_reviews.text: Only complaint is wifi should have been built in on this, especially since it advertises airplay capable. Luckily I was in the position to just plug it in via an extra ethernet port since my switch is right there. Works nicely once connected.
customer_reviews.author: Joe C

customer_reviews.title: Ok Unit Until It Stopped Working Less Than 10 Months Old
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: Bumped my rating to 4 stars after Yamaha made good on their warranty. Stuff breaks, good to see Yamaha stands behind their products. Great unit for the price with features I didn't know I wanted until I used them. Setup is cumbersome via the DOS menu. The User Manual omits or assumes some of the user settings which I only found reading fellow User reviews. 10 MONTHS AND DOA! Less than 10 months old, my unit will not power up. Making claim on the one-year Factory Warranty has been a challenge. It looks like Yamaha USA equipment is serviced by Electronic Service Labs in Trenton, NJ. Anyone have recommendation for Yamaha USA A/V equipment warranty work?
customer_reviews.author: Keldan Media

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 8 months...
customer_reviews.text: The shipping and packaging was great, the product worked great and the price was perfect. I only gave this 3 stars because after 8 months the receiver broke! We took it to an authorized dealer which warranty still covered but it took a month. The back order was for the same part which worries me that this happens often and after a year you eat the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Sarrey

customer_reviews.title: A ton of Bells and Whistles!
customer_reviews.text: This receiver replaced an aging Kenwood unit that was >10 yrs. old so there is really no comparison. This unit was straight forward and easy to connect. Sounds fantastic and has more options included than I can imagine ever making full use of. Surprisingly enough it plays well with my Samsung TV, Samsung Blu-ray, Wii and PlayStation. Awesome receiver for the price!
customer_reviews.author: MichiganMike

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha RX-573
customer_reviews.text: I bought it because the price was right and it had all the options I wanted. (Very basic needs). The unit was hardly used at all, and the receiver is already shot. I can turn it on, and get the radio to tune in, but there is absolutely no volume. The speakers are just fine, it just seems there is something shot in the receiver because I can't get anything output. So now I have perfectly fine 7.1 speakers just sitting around attached to this paper weight.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis L Perry

customer_reviews.title: you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This receiver gets the job done. i actually own Yamaha receiver that i keep in my bed room that gets the job done....i like the ability to connect to the network with this one which works awesomely. i play my music from my mobile devices seamlessly and im able to use this in sync with my smart tv and playstation which is even better.
customer_reviews.author: Greg The Ninja

customer_reviews.title: Does what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: My Sony AV was dying so I searched for a replacement. My last Sony purchases have shown a growing lapse in reliability. This model popped up on an Instapundit Amazon deal alert. Read reviews and specs. It had the basics I was looking for to link in one system all my electronic gear - Satellite, TV, Playstation and DVD recorder. Simple installation, but the capabilities are way above my ability to exploit the system to its fullest. However, the great price made it a 'buy' without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Wolff

customer_reviews.title: A Signature Quality Product!
customer_reviews.text: It shouldn't come as as surprise to anyone that Yamaha is a five star manufacturer of quality audio equipment. I purchased this particular receiver after careful review of several web sites and so far I have not been disappointed in the quality of sound it puts out. great buy too!
customer_reviews.author: RICHRT

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality and sound
customer_reviews.text: This replaces my old Yamaha that worked great and was handed down to another family member. I have an older TV that i love with only one HDMI input so this fit my needs perfectly. I utilize the 7.1 setup and highly recommend it to anyone. Easy setup and I linked it to an app on my phone as a remote. It is plugged into my router directly and all the online radio stations are limitless.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy-Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because of the reviews. It does all I could ever need and much more. The manual is detailed, best of all the sound is A+. The first receiver I found was $1100 and did not want to spend that. This is a great buy and does so much more than my prior old one.
customer_reviews.author: QPawner

customer_reviews.title: Great, but a little confusing to  program everything.
customer_reviews.text: Seems great so far, but it's a little confusing figuring out how to program it. Looks nice, sounds great, seems very well made. Just so many features that it's a little daunting to figure it all out.
customer_reviews.author: Tom C

customer_reviews.title: Every bit of what I expected and more
customer_reviews.text: This piece of equipment is now the center of my A/V experience and it does an excellent job of providing the integration of my audio and visual devices. I would recommend this to anyone who has at least one of the following: TV, Blu-Ray DVD, VCR, Cassette Tape Deck (Dual), Phonograph, Cable Box. I still have 2 HDMI inputs open and could probably connect another optical audio device if I had need for this.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Gilman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this on a fast deal and really didn't know what to expect. This was a replacement for another brand receiver that was almost twice as much. Easy to setup with easy to follow instructions for novice users.
customer_reviews.author: M.A.

customer_reviews.title: ... with my Bose mains and clarion surround speakers is awesome. I've owned this for 2 years now without ...
customer_reviews.text: 700W with my Bose mains and clarion surround speakers is awesome. I've owned this for 2 years now without a single problem.
customer_reviews.author: Vodknockers

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: awesome purchase. i love my yamaha. dont purchase the wifi adapter... sucks
customer_reviews.author: diego0204

customer_reviews.title: Great receiver, more HDMI ports!
customer_reviews.text: Great receiver with a quick and easy set up. The iPad app makes set up and soundfield selection easy. The main draw backs are limited HDMI ports, no front HDMI post, and in some video resolutions the screen goes black for a split second whenever you change the volume.
customer_reviews.author: B. McIntyre

customer_reviews.title: Great Receiver
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is great! Plenty of options, and the networking with AirPlay is great. I really enjoy the ability to use my iPad as a remote since the standard remote is a little cluttered and not intuitive. Overall, this receiver has all the options you need, great sound quality, and a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M

customer_reviews.title: Great Reciever
customer_reviews.text: Much better surround sound than the Onkyo it replaced. Easy to set up and a good value. 7.2 might have been a good option but we are not all that concerned with the latest technology.
customer_reviews.author: Baby Boomer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent receiver for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to round out a pre-installed surround sound system. Extremely happy with it, very easy to set up and sound quality is fantastic. Works well with my 5.1 system and nice to have option to upgrade to 7.1 later.
customer_reviews.author: N. Race

customer_reviews.title: Ecellent buy
customer_reviews.text: The price was right and the features were great. Love the music over the internet. thousands of stations static free. Strong power and mic to tune the room and the B speakers for outside for 300 excellent.
customer_reviews.author: John T. Zeigler

customer_reviews.title: Met most expectations, a few slight problems.
customer_reviews.text: met most expectations, but was hoping for better integration to smart phone for SiriusXM app. There is a problem in "Zone B" where the unit shuts itself off after -20 sound. It won't stay on for more than 3 minutes without over-amping.
customer_reviews.author: drumsdci

customer_reviews.title: Very user friendly
customer_reviews.text: I have my cable box, Xbox, and Blu ray player running to this receiver and it does a great job with surround sound and video pass through. Love it...
customer_reviews.author: BamaJAM

customer_reviews.title: the best of the best at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: this is the best receiver i ever purchased, yamaha rules!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ron L. Southworth

customer_reviews.title: Lots of everything
customer_reviews.text: So far the only hard thing with the 573 is understanding all it will do. Hooked up some Polk 5.1s and a pair of out side speakers and it is just perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Hat Horne

customer_reviews.title: Just wow!
customer_reviews.text: This is a highly configurable and powerful system. I currently have it configured into stereo mode with bi-amplified bookshelf speakers. One day it will support a full, earth-shaking, surround sound system. But, for now, working with what I have and it sounds fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: tjannan

customer_reviews.title: 1 Month Out working well
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup. Seems to mostly configure itself as far as sound settings go. You have a few options but much simpler than the Onkyo I had previously. One of the reasons I purchased it was to replace an Onkyo 7.1 that only had HDMI pass through for audio. This meant the Onkyo wouldn't get surround sound from my Roku player. The Yamaha works great in this respect! Very happy with my purchase. The only negative I have is that when it is turned off there isn't a light giving a visual cue that it has power. Which might be a good thing but isn't the industry norm for electronic devices.
customer_reviews.author: Grumpy Old Man

customer_reviews.title: Great receiver
customer_reviews.text: Great receiver, very easy to hook up. The remote is not so great and since we have so many components we got the Logitech Harmony 650 Remote and combined 4 remotes in one. Only other issue was this receiver comes with a manual on a disc it REALLY needs to come with a hard copy. I finally just printed out the huge thing so I could read through it easily. But so far I love the 5.1 surround sound in our living room, we also hooked up our outdoor and bedroom speakers to the Zone B so full house sound is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Redamber

customer_reviews.title: Awesome system
customer_reviews.text: I got lucky and got this on a daily deal after researching it for a couple of months. Sound is awesome, and auto speaker adjustment worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Jay in KS

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on sale and for the money it has exceeded my expectations. I have owned it for over a month now I continue to be impressed on the sound. If you are looking for a flashy gui or other super high end options; this is not your receiver. But for a midrange biampable network receiver this one can not be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Goose

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Receiver
customer_reviews.text: It did all that and what i was looking for. I use this Yamaha ea. day. The cost was not a factor and Amazon was on time just as it stated.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Withrow

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed, has all of the bells and whistles that I need.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great overall
customer_reviews.text: Great receiver. I especially like the 7 channel stereo option since I have it installed in my basement. The ability to plug in an iPad is great too for playing Pandora. My only complaint is that I haven't been able to get my Android phone to work with it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris W.

customer_reviews.title: Powerful System!
customer_reviews.text: Powerful system. I have been using it for over a year with no issues to report.
customer_reviews.author: Ernesto

customer_reviews.title: phenomenal
customer_reviews.text: this is nothing less than a Yamaha. this unit would be worth the full retail price, but was a steal
customer_reviews.author: Laird

customer_reviews.title: Receiver - Yamaha
customer_reviews.text: EDIT: After about three years, the unit just died, I tried to reset to factory, nothing worked. Sorry Yamaha for the money I spent this should last a lot longer than three years. My previous post still stands, it was great for the time that it worked, not spending more money to try to get it repaired. This was an awesome deal, one of the specials on Amazon that was really worth it. I have had it for a few months now, still working great, really makes the whole entertainment system sound great.
customer_reviews.author: dt

customer_reviews.title: Great features and power for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup, love the onscreen display. Does not get hot like my old Yamaha receiver. Nice remote. Getting Pandora going is hokey, but it works.
customer_reviews.author: Rob H

customer_reviews.title: great sound
customer_reviews.text: The receiver is as described and sounds great. There is a lot of manual options allowing you to really customize the received to what you need. The air play is great and very easy to use. I wish it would also work for android phones but it does not luckily I have a iPod. When you turn the receiver on it automatically turns on the TV and cable box via HDMI but it does not turn off any device when you turn the off receiver. Overall its a good buy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and easy setup!
customer_reviews.text: Such great sound and sooooo easy to set up with the microphone that tests the acoustics of your room to automatically set the levels perfectly. It sounds even better than the 7 yr old Yamaha rxv2400 I replaced that was $2000 at the time
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Good AVR. Very easy to setup and reliable. For the discounted price of 299 it was a no brainer.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really decent starter AVR. Yamaha reliability with features that more expensive setup would cost. Very easy to setup. Still need to go through the electronic manual.
customer_reviews.author: riz

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha is great!
customer_reviews.text: Great receiver! Better than the old receiver I had! Great features! I like the airplay feature! Would definitely recommend anyone to buy this unit. Although I am aware of a newer one if your looking to buy a receiver and want to save some money I would definitely buy this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Receiver
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is excellent. Paired this with Mirage Nano 5.1 system. I upgraded from an Onkyo TX-605 (5 years old). Great product and highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Saint John of LB

customer_reviews.title: It's a Brick
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this am a couple of months ago because it had all the features that I wanted and the price was right, from Warehouse Deals, Inc. I'm a busy guy so didn't get a chance to hook it up until Christmas break. First time I powered on, it tripped off right away. Tried again, no dice. Disconnected everything from it and reset the protection circuit. Tried again. tripped again. It's now outside the 30 day warranty period, so can't return it. My subsequent research indicates that "Warehouse Deals" is a subsidiary of Amazon that sells open box or refurbished items (apparently without properly testing them). So I'm stuck with a brick.
customer_reviews.author: Randolph

customer_reviews.title: Good, but has quirks.
customer_reviews.text: Like the sound quality but the unit has a few quirks. For instance, it locked up my iPod (with Yamaha logo frozen on the display) which forced me to completely wipe and reload it. The unit is also occasionally very slow when switching between HDMI sources.
customer_reviews.author: old guy

customer_reviews.title: Alot for the money
customer_reviews.text: Just that. You get a lot of functions and capabilities for the money. Yamaha alone is a very well built machine.
customer_reviews.author: James Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Great Receiver
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up and sounds great. I like the remote app for my smartphone. The network interface is lacking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: yamaha
customer_reviews.text: please check your subwoofer, because it need a subwoofer amplifier, the rest of it is a excellent product please buy; excellent
customer_reviews.author: carlos reyes

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Receiver
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Receiver the fidelity and sound is great!, I love it Yamaha is my brand prefer the Ypao is good system for distribuited the sound in my JBL speakers, the best combination!
customer_reviews.author: Erlyn

customer_reviews.title: The second zone does not provide enough power to the ...
customer_reviews.text: The second zone does not provide enough power to the speakers, I had to buy another receiver just for the second zone .
customer_reviews.author: TechDev

customer_reviews.title: Great Amp! Very happy!
customer_reviews.text: Havent had any issues with it. Pumps out enough power for my two cerwin-vegas ve-12's. Lots of HDMI ports as well! Great deal!
customer_reviews.author: Jon Emerson

customer_reviews.title: Great AV system for home entertainment
customer_reviews.text: It is worth every penny. Great sound quality and is easy to set up and use. I haven't have any bad issues or negative about it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Li

customer_reviews.title: very good
customer_reviews.text: good and clean sound, easy to install. use it in my network at home and control it with the ipad. very good for the price!
customer_reviews.author: claudio william alves pereira

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha receiver
customer_reviews.text: The Yamaha receiver that I purchased through amazon met all of my expectations. I got it for a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: excellent product at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: This receiver was the perfect fit fot my home theater. Easy set up and plenty of features make this my pick...highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: BigC

customer_reviews.title: Great Receiver!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect sound, and usable functions! Good quality sound for affordable price. The air play works greats, but only with sound, doesn't plays the video.
customer_reviews.author: Aristoteles Canamary Ribeiro Neto

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Once connected to my television and dvd player my tv would turn off after 30 minutes or so of use. Very annoying and embarrassing when you have guests over. This happened constantly for months until I unplugged it and my tv operated normally. I wanted to use it to connect multiple devices but I am now trying to send it back to Yamaha. Unfortunately, at this late date, they will only fix it, not give me my money back. If they can fix it why not do the right thing so that customers do not have to go through all of these changes? Never again!
customer_reviews.author: Maiya Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great Reciever
customer_reviews.text: This receiver is awesome. It sounds excellent with my old Pioneer speakers that are 20 years old. The receiver is fairly easy to set up. It has two downfalls. The first is that for this price I would expect it could use Pandora Internet Radio... The other more important problem is that it cannot send component signals out the HDMI out port. I have to use component from the cable box.. so I cannot run that directly to the receiver, I have to go to TV then back out with SPIDF to the receiver. It makes for a confusing wire mess.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: 1 year 1 month. it is dead
customer_reviews.text: I cant believe this receiver refuses to power up now. I'm now questioning Yamaha brand as more iffy going forward. I for one, would recommend a 3 year warranty route with this brand!
customer_reviews.author: DGD

customer_reviews.title: does everything I expected
customer_reviews.text: I debated the value of the "network" features, but I find them useful. I use the remote control "ap" for my iphone which works great. I plan to use the zone B feature but so far I have not, so no information about that. The audio features are fine. I find them similar to the Yamah receiver that I have had for the last 15 years. No negative comments, it just works like it is supposed to. I am pleased with the product and would recommend it to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Brigham

customer_reviews.title: Poor software. Don't buy.
customer_reviews.text: Hate it. The receiver changes input and audio setting randomly when initially powered on. Requires manual intervention. Super annoying. Also bought an Onkyo which is way better.
customer_reviews.author: DCanuck

customer_reviews.title: Terrific
customer_reviews.text: This is a swell receiver. Easy to set and use. Hooked up my DVD, Blu-Ray, TV and it worked perfectly first time.
customer_reviews.author: Cary Douglass

customer_reviews.title: 20 minutes into a movie and it goes blank!
customer_reviews.text: I hate to say so, but this didn't last 24 hours! I am buying another Yamaha receiver, just not this model. My last Yamaha receiver last us 10 years, what a disappointment!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: I would think a piece of equipment like this would last
customer_reviews.text: HDMI OUTPUT quit working after 2 years. Cannot really use anymore. For $500, I would think a piece of equipment like this would last. I have bought my last Yamaha....
customer_reviews.author: AmazonLover3

customer_reviews.title: State of The Art
customer_reviews.text: "This New State of The Art Receiver," is worth every penny I have spent!! I have mainly used Yamaha receivers over the years both in my bedroom and living room and have been satisfied with their performances. The RX-V573 model which replaced a much older model purchased 17 yrs ago lived up to its reputation and is sending shock waves through my entire home. This latest model has USB and Ipod ports and a bunch of other useful specs. Connecting all my electronic devices(LG blu-ray player, PS3, cable receiver and TV )to this amp was easy and took less than an hour to calibrate the sound to my liking. A very good purchase of a great product!!
customer_reviews.author: H. J. Kirton

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha 573 Receiver
customer_reviews.text: This receiver works great and the quality is terrific. Works well with my Definite Tech Speakers for theater quality. A great buy for the price of $499
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Accornero

customer_reviews.title: Not working after 1 year
customer_reviews.text: I bought this receiver on June 2nd on 2013. This receiver was working just for 1 year. Yesterday it is down and not at all working. :-( Please don't buy this receiver. I'm not sure, if amazon will help or not. :-(
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great Receiver
customer_reviews.text: Great product and value. Easy to setup and use. I would recommend to product to those wanting a great qiality sound with easy to use functions.
customer_reviews.author: Richie Howard

customer_reviews.title: Excellent receiver
customer_reviews.text: I did lots of research and came up with this AV receiver. I have no regrets. Easy to set up and and sounds great. I would highly recommend this receiver.
customer_reviews.author: John Z.

customer_reviews.title: Get ready to rock...
customer_reviews.text: This system rocks! I have the yamaha floor speakers with 15" subs that I bought 12 years ago that finally came alive! I also purchased the yamaha surround speakers so that it would be a complete set. I turned it up as loud as I could stand it and it was still clear as a bell. One of my neighbors who lives across the road and around 200 yds away called me to ask if my house was exploding! Then, my neighbor who lives a quarter of a mile away told me he heard it as well! It is awesome and clear, 2 thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Brad Bookout

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha RX-V573 7.1-Channel Network AV Receiver Yamaha 24
customer_reviews.text: Exchanged it for an older ( 12 yo) Yamaha model that was top of the line back then. This machine is so much better. You will hear the difference right away. It is very powerful. I wish though that there would be an easy option to tone down the base a little, my whole house is usually shaking every time the subwoofer receives input. The owners manual is so long, I am not even trying to read it. That said, setup is very easy, but to get all out if this machine, you need to study quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy A Nyikos

customer_reviews.title: Faulty Power Circuits
customer_reviews.text: For the price and package the Yamaha RX-V573 7.1 Channel Receiver really brings it home. Clear audio and easy to work with. Terminals are easy to work with, banana plugs work fantastically. Easy to set up, easy to use, theater quality sound. The problem is that it comes with faulty power circuits. I purchased one and had it replaced only to have the replacement also go out on me. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Kasey

customer_reviews.title: Great receiver!
customer_reviews.text: Great receiver! Quick note that none of the network functions worked for me until I upgraded to firmware v1.08 (from v1.04). Setup consists of Polk Audio TSi300 and PSW505 (and some unknown surrounds). OSD could use a little spicing up, otherwise sound is fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: jdelmund

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: Like all the HDMI inputs and One Output. From what I had before it sure cut down on all the cables.
customer_reviews.author: DiscoDen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I did not like about this receiver is that there is no plug on the back for the subwoofer. Other than that set-up was alot easier than receivers i've had in the past, just plug in the mic and walk away :) Very happy with it so far!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Not Wifi capable.
customer_reviews.text: This box brags about all of it's wifi capability, but doesn't have an internal wifi pickup. You have to buy that seperate, and Yamaha only has one for another 99 dollars. Coincidentally, that's the price of an Apple TV and all of its competitors. Cmon Yamaha, I don't want to have to pay an extra $100 and have a cord coming out of the front of the only USB connection (really?) that this device has.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Fong

customer_reviews.title: Item not as described
customer_reviews.text: Condition was stated as "Like New", but arrived missing the setup mic and QSG. Returned for refund. Totally disappointed with Yamaha, item felt lightweight and sounded light.
customer_reviews.author: M. Joseph

customer_reviews.title: No Sirus/XM
customer_reviews.text: I was purchasing a new receiver to up grade my system for 3D playback and since I had a Yamaha went with another one. Well I was disappointed on 2 accounts. First the packing job from Amazon was terrible and it is a wonder the unit arrived undamaged since the outer box and flimsy packing material were both damaged. Second Yamaha has done away with the plug that allows Sirus/XM receivers to be plugged into the unit. I have been using XM for a very long time and had no intention of giving it up, so this unit went back.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon E Evans

customer_reviews.title: didnt come with wifi and actuly cost to much cause i got the one touch deal by mistake
customer_reviews.text: turned off my one touch and i decided to keep it .even know that its not the one i wanted , now i just cant seem to bring my self to buy the add on wifi , it cost me like it was top of the like and its not . I set it up anyway and it sounded great for being shoved down my thoat . but still feel like i got the second class amp. at an first class price.
customer_reviews.author: SJH

customer_reviews.title: Little disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I wish there was a manual delivered with the product. I'm sure there is one online but I can't believe for the money one wasn't included. I haven't really been able to utilze it its full potential due to this. I'm hoping it works out but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Leo T

customer_reviews.title: I returned the device. wasnt working.
customer_reviews.text: I had to return the device. it was not in a working condition. I ended buying the same device from best buy
customer_reviews.author: hamed haddadian

customer_reviews.title: YAMAHA PRODUCTS ARE JUNK-DO NOT BUY THEM!!!!
customer_reviews.text: HAD THIS PILE OF CRAP 4 MONTHS AND IT ALREADY BROKE-VERY LITTLE USE ON IT AS WELL. NOW THE AMAZON SUPPLIER REFUSES TO HELP ME WITH A CLEARLY DEFECTIVE PRODUCT-DO NOT BUY ANYTHING FROM "ALWAYS BARGAIN". IF IT COSTS A FEW EXTRA $$$ FOR SOMEONE ELSE SAVE YOURSELF THE PROBLEMS AND BUY IT ELSEWHERE!!!! ALSO WOULD STRONGLY SUGGEST NOT PURCHASING YAMAHA BRAND-THIS IS ABSOLUTELY UNACCEPTABLE!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rick Kovacs

customer_reviews.title: Good, but old fashion quality
customer_reviews.text: Despite being offered as an upgrade, this amplifier still lacks a wifi connection. For internet connectivity it has to be hardwired to a LAN which will make it difficult to get software updates. Typical Yamaha with flat reponse; preset "scene" settings make it easy to program enhanced sound for different media types.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmyjud

customer_reviews.title: it is not bad
customer_reviews.text: I just look for a good receiver for my karaoke system but this one is not works really well so I return.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

product_meta.title: Yamaha RX V573 7.1 Channel Network AV Receiver (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description:
Experience the power of a 7.1 network receiver from Yamaha, the RX-V573. Seven discrete amplifiers provide versatile speaker options, including 7.1 channel surround, Bi-Amp to double power to main speakers, or Zone B for extended audio coverage. The Yamaha AV Controller App works with Apple and Android devices and provides simple yet powerful network control. Enjoy your new receiver with CINEMA DSP 3D, which offers an enveloping home theater experience. Expand connectivity with Apple AirPlay and versatile USB input for iPad compatibility. With included futuristic technologies like 4k video pass-through and ECO mode, the RX-V573 puts the power in your hands.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


YAMAHA RX-V573 7.1-CHANNEL NETWORK AV RECEIVER
 * Key Features 
 * Network receiver with AV Controller App for iPad/iPhone/iPod and Android phones/tablets
 * 7.1-Channel Powerful Surround Sound with 115W per Channel 
 * Apple Airplay Allows Streaming Music to AV Receiver
 * HD Audio format decoding: Dolby TrueHD and DTS-HD Master Audio; Dolby Digital Plus and DTS-HD High Resolution Audio
 * 4K pass-through for next generation super high resolution displays, and HDMI (4 in/1 out) with 3D and Audio Return Channel
 * Front panel USB Digital Connection for iPad/iPod/iPhone & MP3 
 * YPAO sound optimization for automatic speaker setup in minutes
 * Assignable amplifiers for bi-amp connection or Zone B for extended audio in another room
 * ECO mode operation for about 20%* less power consumption

 
EXPERIENCE THE POWER OF A 7.1 NETWORK RECEIVER FROM YAMAHA. INTRODUCING THE RX-V573. ENJOY.
Seven discrete amplifiers provide versatile speaker options, including 7.1 channel surround, Bi-Amp to double power to main speakers, or Zone B for extended audio coverage. The Yamaha AV Controller App works with Apple and Android devices and provides simple yet powerful network control. Enjoy your new receiver with CINEMA DSP 3D, which offers an enveloping home theater experience. Expand connectivity with Apple AirPlay and versatile USB input for iPad compatibility. With included futuristic technologies like 4k video pass-through and ECO mode, the RX-V573 puts the power in your hands. 








4K PASS-THROUGH FOR NEXT GENERATION SUPER HIGH RESOLUTION IMAGES
This AV receiver provides advanced HDMI features including 4K pass-through. 4K refers to four times the resolution of a 1080p display. While not yet available, 4K displays and sources are sure to become popular in the future. This receiver is capable of passing the 4K data from the source to the display, for image clarity far beyond present standards. 






HDMI WITH 3D AND AUDIO RETURN CHANNEL
3D means the receiver can handle 3D signal data. The Audio Return Channel function enables data to be sent and received via the same HDMI cable, so you can hear the sound from the TV via a single HDMI cable, with no need for an extra optical cable.









NETWORK FUNCTIONS
This AV receiver provides a variety of network functions that enable you to access more sources and also enhance operation. You can connect the receiver to a PC to enjoy Internet Radio. The AV Controller app (from iTunes App Store or Android Market) lets you control various functions from your iPod, iPhone, iPad or Android phones.






View the Kindle App AV CONTROLLER APP FOR EASY, CONVENIENT OPERATION
This AV Receiver lets you use the Yamaha AV Controller app that is downloadable from the Amazon App Store, iTunes App Store or Android Market to control power on/off and volume, select input and DSP modes and operate other functions from your Kindle Fire, iPod, iPhone, iPad or Android device. A tablet version is also available.


CONTROL YOUR YAMAHA NETWORK RECEIVER WITH FREE KINDLE FIRE APP
With a Yamaha network receiver you can now control your music and media with our new app designed specifically for the #1 product on Amazon, the Kindle Fire. This application is FREE, and available for download on the Amazon App Store for Kindle Fire and other Android devices. Click here to check out the Kindle App for Yamaha Network Receivers.







AIRPLAY ALLOWS STREAMING MUSIC TO AV RECEIVER
This AV receiver supports AirPlay, which means they can accept wireless music streaming from iPod touch, iPhone or iPad, as well as from iTunes on Macs or PCs. This makes it easy to enjoy music from your mobile devices or computer on your home theater system. You can use view metadata such as song title, artist name as well as album art* via AV receiver's on-screen display. *Some models don't support album art display.









ZONE B OUTPUT PROVIDES 2-CHANNEL SOUND IN A SECOND ROOM
Zone B output capability allows the receiver to send 2-channel sound to a second zone, so the main zone now has 5-channel output. This means that users can enjoy stereo sound in a second room. The same source will play in both zones (cannot use two sources).






HDMI CEC FOR EASY OPERATION
Another benefit of HDMI is the availability of CEC functionality. When the unit is connected to a CEC compatible TV, it will turn on and off together with the TV, and you can use the TV remote to control the volume. CEC also provides advanced functionality with other components. For example, you can use the receiver’s remote unit to control player functions like Skip and Stop. 

*All connected devices must be HDMI CEC compatible. Some CEC compatible TVs/players may not work.






YPAO SOUND OPTIMIZATION FOR AUTOMATIC SPEAKER SETUP
YPAO analyzes the room acoustics and adjusts various audio parameters for optimum sound in just a few minutes. It’s like having a professional installer calibrate your system.










USB DIGITAL CONNECTION FOR IPOD, IPHONE AND IPAD ON THE FRONT PANEL
A USB port on the front panel allows convenient connection of an iPod/iPhone/iPad, which also charges when connected. Because the digital signal from the iPod/iPhone/iPad is transmitted directly to the AV receiver, there is no signal loss or interference, so you enjoy the best possible sound quality. In addition, you can use the receiver’s remote control unit to operate the iPod/iPhone/iPad music playback functions.






SCENE FOR ONE-TOUCH START
Pressing a SCENE button powers on the AV Receiver and selects the input source and DSP mode. You can re-set the buttons for different sources by selecting a source and DSP mode, then pressing a SCENE button for more than three seconds.






HD AUDIO WITH CINEMA DSP 3D AND VIRTUAL PRESENCE SPEAKER
CINEMA DSP 3D provides a wide, high and dense sound field. HD Audio format decoding lets you enjoy HD Audio sources. Virtual Presence Speaker delivers 3-dimensional sound without actual use of presence speakers.









INPUT SELECTION IN HDMI STANDBY THROUGH MODE
When the AV receiver is in HDMI Standby Through mode, the input source (Blu-ray™ Disc player, game console, etc.) for viewing on the monitor can be changed via the remote control. There’s no need to turn on the AV receiver in order to switch sources.









SUBWOOFER TRIM FOR IMPROVED SOUND IMAGING
The Subwoofer Trim control enhances the low frequencies by avoiding overlap with the front speaker output. This will result in a cleaner, more focused sound stage while providing a seamless frequency response. When subwoofer frequency overlap occurs in conventional systems, the overall sound is “pushed” toward the subwoofer. Subwoofer Trim takes care of this by separating the low subwoofer frequencies cleanly, thus stabilizing the front stage while providing a well-balanced enhanced bass sound.






COMPRESSED MUSIC ENHANCER
When music is encoded into a digitally compressed format like MP3, the frequency response suffers. Yamaha’s Compressed Music Enhancer employs sophisticated digital signal processing using exclusive algorithms to restore what was lost, so the music always sounds the way it should.







ADAPTIVE DRC (DYNAMIC RANGE CONTROL)
Adaptive DRC automatically adjusts the dynamic range of the sound according to the volume level. This ensures that you hear clear dialogue and vocals, and all sound effects at comfortable levels. There is no need to adjust the volume level as you listen; everything from whispers to big explosions will be heard clearly and comfortably at the same volume setting. It also tones down loud TV commercials, and is ideal for low-volume, late-night listening, when you do not want to disturb others.






ECO MODE LOWERS POWER CONSUMPTION BY 20%*
Yamaha’s new ECO mode reduces power consumption by about 20%. It can be set from the top of the GUI menu. 
* Compared to power consumption when ECO mode is off (Yamaha measurement).

SELECTABLE AUTO POWER DOWN
Auto Power Down lets you save energy by selecting to turn off the power after 2, 4, 8 or 12 hours. 
* Compared to power consumption when ECO mode is off (Yamaha measurement).


LOW STANDBY POWER CONSUMPTION
Yamaha makes its receivers eco-friendly with a low standby power consumption of 0.1W in IR Standby mode (1W in HDMI Standby Through mode, 2W in Network Standby mode).






OTHER NOTABLE ADVANCED FEATURES
 * Charging of iPod, iPhone and iPad via USB when AV Receiver is off 
 * iPod/iPhone song titles displayed in English and Western European languages on the front panel 
 * Multi language color OSD for improved visibility 
 * Audio input assign capability for HDMI and component video input 
 * Front panel mini jack input for connecting portable audio player 
 * Audio input assign capability for HDMI and component video input 
 * 9 selectable subwoofer crossover frequencies 
 * Subwoofer phase select / Subwoofer out 
 * Initial Volume Setting and Maximum Volume Setting 
 * Audio Delay for adjusting Lip-Sync (0-250 ms)
 * 40-station preset tuning / Auto preset tuning
 * Background Video feature (for Radio only)






WHICH YAMAHA RX-V SERIES RECEIVER IS RIGHT FOR YOU?
YAMAHA RX-V373
Check out the Yamaha RX-V373 YAMAHA RX-V473
Check out the Yamaha RX-V473 YAMAHA RX-V573
